title: 9News Brisbane | Monday November 24 | Full Episode
description: Melissa Downs and Joel Dry lead the Queensland news, beginning with the widespread Storm Destruction Across South East Queensland, which left over 150,000 homes without power and caused extensive property damage, including giant hail. The Sea World Helicopter Crash Inquest opens, with harrowing new survivor testimony and compelling new evidence, including a key finding that neither pilot saw the other aircraft. In Federal Politics, Pauline Hanson's Burqa Stunt in the Senate causes chaos and a rare suspension of the upper house, and a major update in the Search for Missing 4-Year-Old Gus Lamont has police focusing on abandoned mine shafts.  Also, a major police operation in Beaumont Hills saw schools and residents locked down after reports of a man brandishing a rifle, which was later revealed to be a fake firearm found in the rubbish. Plus, Chris Hemsworth begins filming his new movie, and a Titanic pocket watch fetches a record-breaking $3.6 million at auction.  0:08 | Widespread Storm Destruction Across South East Queensland  2:42 | Wild Weather Forecast and Storm Cells Tracking  3:38 | Sea World Helicopter Crash Inquest Begins with New Evidence  7:29 | Pauline Hanson's Burqa Stunt in the Senate Causes Chaos  9:35 | Top Chinese Official Visits Canberra  10:13 | Deadly Southport House Fire  10:33 | Suspicious Sunnybank Hills Blaze  11:24 | Queensland Teacher Strike Threatens Exams at 109 Schools  12:52 | $662M Queensland Coal Mine Expansion Fast-Tracked  13:30 | Israel Kills Hezbollah Military Chief in Beirut Strike  14:08 | Ukraine and US Officials Hold "Highly Productive" Peace Talks 14:47 | Donald Trump Slams Ukraine Leadership Over Gratitude  15:50 | Final Farewell for Former Police Union President Ian Leavers  16:34 | Search for Missing 4-Year-Old Gus Lamont Focuses on Mine Shafts  17:43 | Former UK Prime Minister David Cameron Diagnosed with Prostate Cancer  18:01 | Australian Deported From Singapore After Red Carpet Stunt  18:25 | Social Media Shutdown: Advice for Families  18:40 | Michelin Star Chef Skye Gyngell Dies, First Australian Woman to Earn Honour 19:24 | Sydney Suburbs in Lockdown Over Frightening False Alarm   | *Subscribe and ðŸ””: http://9Soci.al/KM6e50GjSK9*  *Get more breaking news at 9News.com.au: http://9Soci.al/iyCO50GjSK6*  FOLLOW 9News Australia â–º Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/9News/ â–º Twitter: https://twitter.com/9NewsAUS â–º Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/9news/  Join 9News for the latest in news and events that affect you in your local city, as well as news from across Australia and the world.  #9News #BreakingNews #NineNewsAustralia #9NewsAU

title: 9News Melbourne | Monday November 24 | Full Episode
description: Alicia Loxley and Tom Steinfort present the Melbourne news, covering the Metro Tunnel safety crisis, as the Firefighters Union raises serious alarm bells about radio communication faults just before the new rail line is set to open. Also, the Sea World helicopter crash inquest begins, with a coroner showing shocking, never-before-seen footage from the doomed choppers, and a survivor recounts the terrifying final moments. Plus, Pauline Hanson sparks a furious debate in the Federal Senate after wearing a burqa, and an EastLink emergency sees major traffic delays after a serious car crash. title: 9News Adelaide | Monday November 24 | Full Episode
description: Brenton Ragless leads the Adelaide news, with a major update in the search for missing four-year-old Gus Lamont in South Australia's outback. It also covers the tragic death of a CFS firefighter on the Eyre Peninsula and the political fallout from Pauline Hanson's controversial burqa stunt in the Senate.
